{
  "article_text": [
    "we address the existence problem for periodic orbits of hamiltonian flows on twisted cotangent bundles . these flows model the dynamics of a charged particle in a magnetic field .",
    "more specifically , we focus here on the case where the base is equipped with a metric of negative scalar curvature .",
    "let us start our discussion by describing some recent results which are relevant to us . + it is a well - known fact that the flow generated by a @xmath6-small hamiltonian has no non - trivial one - periodic orbits , i.e. , all its periodic orbits are fixed points .",
    "it follows then , that for the flow to have such periodic orbits , the hamiltonian must have , in some sense , a big enough oscillation . the next result is a particular instance of this general principle .    *",
    "( thm 2.4 , @xcite ) * [ teo-1 ] let @xmath0 be a closed symplectic submanifold of a geometrically bounded , symplectically aspherical manifold @xmath7 and let @xmath8 be a sufficiently small neighbourhood of @xmath0 .",
    "let @xmath9 be the collection of compactly supported hamiltonians that are constant in a neighbourhood of @xmath0 and such that @xmath10 .",
    "then there exists a constant @xmath11 such that the hamiltonian flow of every @xmath12 with @xmath13 has a non - trivial contractible one - periodic orbit with action greater than @xmath14 .",
    "some of the key ideas in the proof of theorem [ teo-1 ] are also building blocks of the proof of the following theorem , which was proved for negatively curved manifolds in @xcite and for arbitrary manifolds in @xcite .",
    "[ teo-2]let @xmath0 be a closed , connected manifold , @xmath15 its cotangent bundle endowed with the canonical symplectic form @xmath16 and @xmath17 a proper , bounded below hamiltonian .",
    "assume that a sublevel set @xmath18 contains the zero section .",
    "then , for every non - trivial class @xmath5 in the set of free homotopy classes of loops in @xmath0 , there is a dense set of energy values @xmath19 such that the level set @xmath20 contains a closed orbit @xmath21 in the class @xmath5 , with @xmath22 .",
    "as we said in the previous paragraph , the proofs of these results are related , as they are based on arguments relying on filtered floer homology , symplectic homology and symplectic capacities .",
    "we recall that the filtered floer homology of a hamiltonian is the homology of a chain complex generated by one - periodic orbits whose actions lie in a certain range .",
    "non - triviality of this floer homology would guarantee the existence of one - periodic orbits , but to explicitly compute it from the definition , we need precisely these same periodic orbits to generate our chain complex .",
    "this circular argument is a problem already present in floer s proof of arnold s conjecture .",
    "the basic idea for solving it , is to relate the floer homology to the geometry and topology of the manifold on which the dynamics takes place .",
    "we roughly describe now the way in which this idea is carried out in the articles just mentioned . given a hamiltonian @xmath23 ,",
    "two functions are constructed , bounding @xmath23 from above and below , respectively .",
    "these functions `` capture '' some information about the geometry of the manifold and as a result , their filtered floer homologies are amenable to computation and are non - trivial .",
    "then , a special monotone homotopy between these squeezing functions is defined and as a consequence of standard results , their filtered floer homologies are isomorphic . this isomorphism factors through the filtered floer homology of @xmath23 , which is thus non - trivial .",
    "this implies the existence of a one - periodic orbit for the flow of @xmath23 .",
    "+ we introduce now the setting in which we work and state our main results .",
    "let @xmath24 be a closed , negatively curved riemannian manifold and @xmath1 a neighbourhood of finite radius @xmath25 about @xmath0 in @xmath2 .",
    "let @xmath26 be a closed @xmath27-form , which we call the magnetic field , and @xmath28 the standard symplectic form on @xmath2 .",
    "let @xmath5 be a fixed non - trivial class in @xmath29 , the space of free homotopy classes of loops in @xmath0 . throughout the article",
    ", we identify @xmath29 and @xmath30 .",
    "[ first - theo ] let @xmath31 . then",
    ", there exist constants @xmath32 and @xmath33 such that if @xmath34 , the flow of @xmath23 with respect to @xmath35 has a one - periodic orbit in @xmath5 , for any magnetic field @xmath4 with @xmath36 .",
    "we now introduce the class @xmath37 of hamiltonians @xmath23 such that    * @xmath38 ; * @xmath23 depends only on @xmath39 in a fixed neighbourhood @xmath40 of @xmath0 ; * @xmath41 , for all @xmath39 .",
    "[ second - theo ] there exist constants @xmath42 and @xmath43 such that for any @xmath44 with @xmath45 , the flow of @xmath23 with respect to @xmath35 has a one - periodic orbit in @xmath5 , for any magnetic field @xmath4 with @xmath36 .",
    "* remark * the value of the constant @xmath42 is computed in section [ constru - k ] , where it is shown that one can take @xmath46 , where @xmath47 is the length of the unique closed geodesic @xmath48 in the class @xmath5 for the geodesic flow of @xmath49 .",
    "+ let @xmath50 be the relative hofer - zehner capacity introduced in @xcite .",
    "then , from this remark and theorem 2.9 from @xcite we obtain the following    [ first - coro ] @xmath51    the class @xmath52 plays an essential role in theorem [ second - theo ] , allowing us to bound the magnitude of the magnetic field _ in terms of @xmath40 and @xmath49 only_. in other words , _ every _ magnetic field with magnitude less than @xmath53 is such that the magnetic flow of _ every _ hamiltonian with big enough oscillation has a @xmath54-periodic orbit in @xmath5 .",
    "if the hamiltonian @xmath23 is not in @xmath52 , theorem [ first - theo ] still guarantees the existence of a @xmath54-periodic orbit in @xmath5 .",
    "however , in this case , the magnitude of the magnetic field _ depends on @xmath23_.    in the following proposition we construct an example that shows that theorem [ second - theo ] fails if @xmath23 is not in @xmath52 .",
    "it also shows that the magnetic term in theorem [ first - theo ] may be arbitrarily small .",
    "we remark that the hamiltonians constructed in this example can have arbitrarily large oscilations .",
    "[ propo-1 ]",
    "let @xmath0 be a surface endowed with a metric of constant negative curvature equal to @xmath55 and @xmath56 an arbitrarily large constant .",
    "then , there exists a sequence of hamiltonians @xmath57 with compact support in @xmath58 , eventually leaving @xmath52 and with @xmath59 and a sequence of magnetic fields @xmath60 , with @xmath61 , such that the periodic orbits of the hamiltonian flow of @xmath62 with respect to @xmath63 , are all contractible .",
    "we recall now the definition of the @xmath64-sensitive relative symplectic capacity introduced in @xcite .",
    "let @xmath65 be an open symplectic manifold and @xmath66 be the family of hamiltonians with compact support in @xmath67 .",
    "let us denote by @xmath68 the set of @xmath54-periodic orbits of the flow of @xmath23 in the class @xmath5 and by @xmath69 the class    @xmath70    where @xmath71 is a compact subset of @xmath72 .",
    "we then define the relative symplectic capacity    @xmath73    similarly to corollary [ first - coro ] we obtain    @xmath74    when @xmath75 , it follows from theorem 3.2.1 in @xcite that @xmath76 .",
    "however , as an immediate consequence of proposition [ propo-1 ] we obtain    [ propo-2 ] for every @xmath77 , there exists a magnetic field @xmath4 with @xmath78 such that @xmath79    this corollary expresses the failure of theorem [ second - theo ] in terms of this special symplectic capacity .",
    "+ there are many results concerning existence of periodic orbits for hamiltonian flows on twisted cotangent bundles . in the case of non - trivial contractible orbits of twisted geodesic flows ,",
    "existence has been proved , under various hypothesis in @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite and @xcite . for results about existence of non - contractible orbits ,",
    "see @xcite , @xcite , @xcite and @xcite .",
    "+ this article is organized as follows . in section [ tools ]",
    "we introduce all the definitions and statements we need to prove our result .",
    "more precisely , in section [ neg - curv ] we describe the dynamics of geodesic and magnetic flows and state some dynamical properties of the geodesic flows of negatively curved riemannian manifolds . then ,",
    "in section [ floer ] we define filtered floer homology and state some of its basic properties . in section [ proofs ] , we prove theorem [ second - theo ] .",
    "we omit the proof of theorem [ first - theo ] as it is analogous to the one of theorem [ second - theo ] . in section [ constru - k ]",
    "we define the squeezing functions mentioned in the introduction .",
    "we compute their floer homologies , working with the standard symplectic form in section [ compute ] and with the twisted symplectic form in section [ perturb ] , where we complete the proof of the theorem following the ideas described after theorems [ teo-1 ] and [ teo-2 ] . finally , in section [ counter ] , we prove proposition [ propo-1 ] .",
    "+ * acknowledgments * the author is deeply grateful to viktor ginzburg for his constant encouragement , advice and support .",
    "he thanks baak grel and ely kerman for helpful discussions and suggestions .",
    "we give here the definitions and state the basic results we will need . in section [ neg - curv ] , we introduce the definitions and properties of geodesic and magnetic flows and negatively curved riemannian manifolds .",
    "we follow @xcite in our presentation of geodesic flows as hamiltonian ones on @xmath80 . for the geometry and dynamics of geodesic flows on negatively curved riemannian manifolds , see @xcite",
    ". then , in section [ floer ] , we define the filtered floer homology , restricted to a non - trivial class @xmath81 of a compactly supported hamiltonian in a twisted cotangent bundle over a negatively curved riemannian manifold @xmath0 . as twisted cotangent bundles",
    "are geometrically bounded symplectic manifolds ( see @xcite , @xcite ) , we follow @xcite .",
    "+      let @xmath24 be a closed riemannian manifold of dimension @xmath82 .",
    "the geodesic flow of the metric @xmath49 is the map @xmath83 , given by @xmath84 , where @xmath85 is the geodesic such that @xmath86 and @xmath87 .",
    "it becomes a hamiltonian flow for @xmath88 , on the symplectic manifold @xmath89 , where @xmath90 is the pullback of the standard symplectic form on @xmath2 by the metric .",
    "using the standard splitting @xmath91 , where @xmath92 is the lift of @xmath93 by the metric and @xmath94 is the kernel of @xmath95 , for @xmath96 , it is easy to check that the geodesic vector field @xmath97 is    @xmath98    the isomorphism between @xmath80 and @xmath2 given by the metric makes the geodesic flow orbit equivalent to the flow of @xmath99 on @xmath100 .",
    "+ let @xmath101 be a closed @xmath27-form on @xmath0 .",
    "the magnetic flow ( or twisted geodesic flow ) is the hamiltonian flow of @xmath102 on @xmath103 .",
    "the lorentz force is the skew - symmetric linear map @xmath104 such that    @xmath105    then the hamiltonian vector field @xmath106 of @xmath23 with respect to the form @xmath107 can be expressed as    @xmath108    for @xmath109 .",
    "a curve @xmath110 in @xmath80 is an integral curve of @xmath111 if and only if    @xmath112    for the covariant derivative @xmath113 .",
    "this equation is just newton s law for a charged particle of unit mass and charge . + negative sectional curvature of the metric @xmath49 places restrictions on the topology of @xmath0 and gives the geodesic flow important dynamical properties .",
    "we mention here the ones that are relevant to our work .",
    "the first property is that every free homotopy class of loops on @xmath0 contains a unique closed geodesic , which minimizes length in its class .",
    "the second one is that , being anosov , a geodesic flows @xmath114 on a negatively curved manifold is @xmath3 strongly structurally stable .",
    "this means that any flow @xmath115 which is close enough to @xmath116 in the @xmath3 topology , is @xmath117 orbit equivalent to it . in other words",
    ", there exists a homeomorphism @xmath118 , which can be chosen close enough to identity if the perturbation is small enough , such that @xmath119 equals @xmath120 , up to a time change .",
    "we describe now a property of negatively curved riemannian manifolds that will allow us to have a well defined action functional for detecting non - contractible one - periodic orbits .",
    "we say that a manifold @xmath0 is _ atoroidal _ , if every continuous map @xmath121 , is such that @xmath122 is the zero map . we claim that this is true for a manifold @xmath0 that admits a metric of negative sectional curvature .",
    "we note first that in this case , the induced map @xmath123 is not a monomorphism , as all abelian subgroups of @xmath124 are infinite cyclic ( see @xcite , @xcite ) . after passing to a finite cover @xmath125 and changing coordinates if necessary",
    ", we can assume that the lifted map @xmath126 is such that @xmath127 , where @xmath128 ( i.e. the image by @xmath129 of a meridian @xmath130 of @xmath125 , bounds a disk in @xmath0 ) . the cycle @xmath131 is homologous to zero in @xmath0 , as can be seen from the following argument .",
    "let us cut @xmath125 along the curve @xmath130 and close the ends of the cylinder so obtained with disks .",
    "this surface is homeomophic to a sphere , so the resulting map @xmath132 can be identified with a map from @xmath133 to @xmath0 . as @xmath134 for a manifold admitting a metric of negative scalar curvature , @xmath132 has to be homotopic to a constant map . as a consequence @xmath129 extends to the solid torus and hence @xmath135",
    "$ ] is zero in @xmath136 .",
    "therefore @xmath137 $ ] is zero in @xmath138 .",
    "this proves our claim .",
    "a twisted cotangent bundle is the symplectic manifold @xmath139 , where @xmath140 is the standard symplectic form on @xmath2 , and @xmath26 is a closed two form , called the magnetic field .",

    "this functional is well defined , as the second term in ( [ eq : actionfunctional ] ) does not depend on the annulus @xmath152 due to the atoroidal condition .",

    "pick a different cylinder @xmath189 and extend @xmath180 to obtain @xmath190 , inducing a new trivialization @xmath191 of @xmath186 . by gluing @xmath181 and @xmath189 appropiately",
    ", we obtain a smooth map @xmath192 , which induces the trivial symplectic pullback bundle @xmath193 over @xmath194 , as @xmath195 and the dimension of the base is @xmath27 . without loss of generality",
    "we can assume that the trivialization @xmath196 is such that it coincides with @xmath180 along @xmath179 .",
    "it follows that @xmath197 is homotopic to @xmath187 and @xmath191 .",
    "this proves that the conley - zehnder index of @xmath150 is independent of the trivialization of @xmath186 .",

    "+ we state now some basic lemmas that relate the floer homology of two functions .",
    "let us denote the action spectrum of @xmath207 in @xmath5 by    @xmath208    let @xmath23 and @xmath209 be two functions in    @xmath210    such that @xmath211 in @xmath212 .",
    "for such functions , there exists a monotone homotopy @xmath213 from @xmath23 to @xmath209 , i.e. , a family of functions @xmath214 such that    @xmath215 $ \\cr                   k \\ , & $ s \\in [ 1 , + \\infty)$. \\cr } \\ ] ]    and @xmath216 .",
    "this induces a chain complex map @xmath217 which in turn gives rise to a homomorphism in homology    @xmath218    [ lema - floer-1 ] the homomorphism @xmath219 is independent of the choice of monotone homotopy and the following identities hold :    @xmath220    for @xmath221 .",
    "[ lema - floer-2 ] if @xmath222 for all @xmath223 $ ] , then @xmath219 is an isomorphism .",
    "the second lemma says that the only way that @xmath224 can fail to be an isomorphism , is if periodic orbits with action equal to @xmath156 or @xmath157 are created during the monotone homotopy .",
    "for proofs of these lemmas , see @xcite , @xcite and @xcite .",
    "+ * remark * we have defined the filtered floer homology of a hamiltonian whose @xmath54-periodioc orbits are nondegenerate . however , it is possible to extend this definition to the space @xmath225 .",
    "let us endow this set with the strong whitney @xmath226 topology .",
    "then , there exists a neighbourhood @xmath40 containing @xmath227 such that the filtered floer homologies of every @xmath228 _ with nondegenerate periodic orbits _",
    "are isomorphic .",
    "we can then define @xmath229 , even when @xmath23 has degenerate periodic orbits , as @xmath230 . for details and proofs , see @xcite , @xcite and @xcite .",
    "before proceeding with the proof itself , we give a detailed sketch of it . from now on ,",
    "we denote by @xmath231 and @xmath232 the filtered floer homologies obtained by using the standard symplectic form @xmath28 and the twisted symplectic form @xmath35 respectively .",
    "+ let @xmath44 .",
    "the idea for proving theorem [ second - theo ] is to construct functions @xmath233 and @xmath234 such that @xmath235 and      for some interval @xmath203 . if we can find a monotone homotopy @xmath237 connecting @xmath234 and @xmath233 such that @xmath222 , lemma [ lema - floer-2 ] would imply that @xmath238 , as the isomorphism ( [ eq : isomorphism ] ) factors through this floer homology group .",
    "the function @xmath234 will be constructed in section [ constru - k ] as an autonomous hamiltonian whose flow _ with respect to the standard symplectic form @xmath239 _ on every energy level , is a reparametrization of the geodesic flow on that level . to achieve this",
    ", we will take @xmath240 , where @xmath241 is the norm on the fibers , i.e. @xmath242 . the fact that the geodesic flow of @xmath49 has a unique closed geodesic in every nontrivial class @xmath5 when @xmath0 is negatively curved will force , under certain conditions , the flow of @xmath234 with respect to the standard symplectic form to have periodic orbits in @xmath5",
    ". the construction of @xmath233 will be similar to that of @xmath234 .",
    "we remark that both @xmath234 and @xmath233 are in @xmath243 . after choosing an appropiate action interval , in section [ compute ] we will compute @xmath244 and show that it is non - trivial .    in section [ perturb ]",
    "we prove theorem [ second - theo ] . to achieve this ,",
    "we first prove proposition [ iso - mag - st - kplus ] , which says that the floer homologies of @xmath234 and @xmath233 with respect to @xmath168 are non - trivial and isomorphic , provided that the magnetic field @xmath4 is sufficiently small , where the bound on the magnitude of @xmath4 can be chosen to depend only on @xmath40 and @xmath49 .",
    "this result follows essentially from the strong structural stability of the geodesic flow and from the fact that @xmath234 and @xmath233 are in @xmath52 .",
    "we then construct a monotone homotopy @xmath245 connecting @xmath234 and @xmath233 .",
    "proposition [ iso - mag - st - kplus ] guarantees that the floer homology of @xmath214 remains constant along the homotopy , which proves the theorem .      in this section",
    "we construct functions @xmath247 , supported in @xmath1 with @xmath248 and such that their flows _ with respect to the symplectic form @xmath28 _ have one - periodic orbits in the non - trivial class @xmath5 .",
    "from now on we fix @xmath249 . + before constructing these functions , we find the condition that must hold for their flows to have the required one - periodic orbit in @xmath5 .",

    "this means that there exists an @xmath307 such that if @xmath308 , then the flows of @xmath234 with respect to @xmath251 and @xmath168 are topologically conjugate on the unit energy level , the conjugation being close to the identity .",
    "let @xmath309 be as in section [ constru - k ] , i.e. such that @xmath310 .",
    "a scaling argument shows that on this energy level , the flows of @xmath234 with respect to @xmath251 and @xmath168 are topologically conjugate if @xmath36 , for @xmath311 . as @xmath312",
    ", we can make @xmath313 independent of @xmath23 by choosing @xmath314 , for @xmath269 the radius of the fixed neighbourhood @xmath40 . by ( [ eq : period ] ) ,",
    "on energy levels near @xmath315 , periodic orbits of @xmath316 have period @xmath317 .",
    "as by construction @xmath318 , transversality of ( [ eq : period ] ) to @xmath319 at @xmath309 implies that for every magnetic field @xmath4 with @xmath36 , there exists @xmath320 such that the periodic orbits of @xmath321 in the class @xmath5 and level @xmath320 have period @xmath54 .",
    "we denote the set of such orbits as @xmath322 .",
    "all sets @xmath323 are homeomorphic to @xmath295 and by lemma [ lema - uno ] , this is homeomorphic to @xmath324 .",
    "then , the structural stability of the flow of @xmath234 implies that @xmath322 is homeomorphic to @xmath324 . by taking a smaller @xmath313 if necessary",
    ", we can assume that the action of @xmath325 is still in the interval @xmath203 chosen in ( [ eq : interval ] ) and that @xmath326 .",
    "then , by theorem [ version ]      which proves the proposition",
    ". @xmath328 + * remark * proposition [ iso - mag - st - kplus ] still holds when @xmath23 is not in @xmath52 , but with @xmath329 for @xmath233 . to see this , note that the proof breaks down when trying to find a uniform bound for the magnitude of the magnetic field , as @xmath330 , for @xmath270 , when the support of @xmath23 is small enough .",
    "+ * proof of theorem [ second - theo ] * we construct first a monotone homotopy @xmath331}$ ] connecting @xmath234 and @xmath233 .",
    "let us take @xmath234 and , leaving the top of its graph fixed , `` push '' its graph to the left , as shown in figure [ homotopia ] .",
    "it is clear that the only points at which @xmath332 are the images by the homotopy of @xmath286 and @xmath333 .",
    "action values for them are decreasing , so @xmath334 , where @xmath335 is as in ( [ eq : functional - small ] ) goes away from @xmath156 and @xmath336 decreases to @xmath337 .",
    "then , as seen in figure [ homotopia ] , we push the graph obtained in the first step down , completing the homotopy .",
    "as before , no new points points at @xmath332 appear and the action values for @xmath286 stay away from @xmath156 .",
    "thus , no new periodic orbits with action equal to @xmath156 are created .",
    "then , for @xmath313 and @xmath4 as in proposition [ iso - mag - st - kplus ] , we conclude that @xmath338 , for @xmath223 $ ] . from lemmas [ lema - floer-1 ] and [ lema - floer-2 ]",
    ", it follows that          in this section we prove proposition [ propo-1 ] .",
    "more specifically , we construct a sequence of compactly supported hamiltonians @xmath62 , eventually leaving @xmath52 and with arbitrarily large variation , and a sequence of magnetic terms @xmath340 with magnitude tending to zero , such that the periodic orbits of the magnetic flow of @xmath62 are all contractible .",
    "this shows that theorem [ second - theo ] fails if @xmath23 is not @xmath52 .",
    "it also shows that the magnitude of the perturbation in theorem [ first - theo ] may be arbitrarily small .",
    "+ we describe now the setting in which we work .",
    "let @xmath0 be a @xmath27-dimensional riemannian manifold with negative curvature constantly equal to @xmath55 and let @xmath341 be the area form .",
    "we endow the cotangent bundle @xmath2 with the symplectic form @xmath342 , where @xmath239 is the standard symplectic form of @xmath2 and @xmath343 is the charge of the magnetic field .",
    "we again identify @xmath2 and @xmath80 through the metric and we work on @xmath80 , using the structures introduced in section [ neg - curv ] .        where @xmath303 is a compatible almost complex structure on @xmath80 such that @xmath304 and @xmath347 is the lorentz force for @xmath348 .",
    "the behaviour of the twisted geodesic flow is qualitatively very different , for different values of @xmath349 . for @xmath350 ,",
    "it is smoothly diffeomorphic to the geodesic flow .",
    "for @xmath351 , it has no closed trajectories . for @xmath352 ,",
    "all of its orbits are periodic and its projections on @xmath0 are contractible . + before proceeding with the proof , we give a detailed sketch of it .",
    "let @xmath353 be as @xmath234 in section [ constru - k ] .",
    "by ( [ eq : slope ] ) , there will be a @xmath54-periodic orbit in a given non - trivial class @xmath5 on the energy level @xmath354 where @xmath355 , for @xmath47 the length of the unique closed geodesic in @xmath5 .",
    "as @xmath0 is closed and negatively curved and @xmath209 is compactly supported , there are finitely many classes @xmath356 for which the equation      holds for some @xmath358 $ ] .",
    "note that by condition @xmath359 in the construction of @xmath234 in section [ constru - k ] , each of the equations ( [ eq : ecu - clases ] ) holds at two different energy levels , which we denote by @xmath360 .",
    "our goal is to construct a magnetic field @xmath4 such that the hamiltonian vector field of @xmath102 with respect to @xmath361 on each critical level @xmath362 induces dynamics like the one for @xmath352 in ( [ eq : horo - vector ] ) , i.e. all orbits on those levels are periodic with contractible projections .",
    "note that this does not contradict theorem [ second - theo ] , as the magnitude of @xmath4 will be large .",
    "then , a scaling argument will give us the desired sequences @xmath363 and @xmath364 , with @xmath365 .",
    "+ * proof of proposition [ propo-1 ] * let @xmath209 be as @xmath234 in section [ constru - k ] .",
    "we define the magnetic field @xmath366 as      where @xmath368 , @xmath348 is the area form and @xmath369 , where @xmath25 and @xmath370 are as in proposition [ iso - mag - st - kplus ] .",
    "clearly this makes the @xmath371size of @xmath4 greater than that of the magnetic fields allowed by theorem [ second - theo ] .",

    "note that for @xmath82 big enough , @xmath62 is not in @xmath52 . the argument used for @xmath209 carries over to @xmath363 and clearly @xmath386 . to complete the proof",
    ", we note that we can make @xmath387 arbitrarily large by scaling @xmath62 .",
    "@xmath328 +                      ginzburg , v. and kerman , e. ; _ periodic orbits in magnetic fields in dimensions greater than two _ , geometry and topology in dynamics ( winston - salem , n.c .",
    "1998 ; san antonio , tx , 1999 ) , contemp . math .",
    "* 246 * , ( 1999 ) , 113 - 121 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> for many classes of symplectic manifolds , the hamiltonian flow of a function with sufficiently large variation must have a fast periodic orbit . </S>",
    "<S> this principle is the base of the notion of hofer - zehnder capacity and some other symplectic invariants and leads to numerous results concerning existence of periodic orbits of hamiltonian flows . along these lines , we show that given a negatively curved manifold @xmath0 , a neigbourhood @xmath1 of @xmath0 in @xmath2 , a sufficiently @xmath3-small magnetic field @xmath4 and a non - trivial free homotopy class of loops @xmath5 , then the magnetic flow of certain hamiltonians supported in @xmath1 with big enough minimum , has a one - periodic orbit in @xmath5 . as a consequence , </S>",
    "<S> we obtain estimates for the relative hofer - zehnder capacity and the biran - polterovich - salamon capacity of a neighbourhood of @xmath0 . </S>"
  ]
}
